text.title: England | Latest News & Updates | BBC News
text.text:
England | Latest News & Updates | BBC News Skip to content British Broadcasting Corporation Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Israel-Gaza War War in Ukraine US & Canada UK Africa Asia Australia Europe Latin America Middle East In Pictures BBC InDepth BBC Verify Home News Israel-Gaza War War in Ukraine US & Canada UK UK Politics England N. Ireland N. Ireland Politics Scotland Scotland Politics Wales Wales Politics Africa Asia China India Australia Europe Latin America Middle East In Pictures BBC InDepth BBC Verify Sport Business Executive Lounge Technology of Business Future of Business Innovation Technology Science & Health Artificial Intelligence AI v the Mind Culture Film & TV Music Art & Design Style Books Entertainment News Arts Arts in Motion Travel Destinations Africa Antarctica Asia Australia and Pacific Caribbean & Bermuda Central America Europe Middle East North America South America World’s Table Culture & Experiences Adventures The SpeciaList Earth Natural Wonders Weather & Science Climate Solutions Sustainable Business Green Living Audio Podcast Categories Radio Audio FAQs Video BBC Maestro Live Live News Live Sport Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Weather Newsletters News News UK UK Politics England N. Ireland Scotland Wales LIVE Putin 'morally responsible' for 'unsurvivable' Novichok poisoning of Dawn Sturgess, inquiry finds An inquiry into Ms Sturgess' death in 2018 came after an attempt to poison an ex-Russian double agent living in Salisbury. LIVE 'My business has lost £15k so far' - Kent water crisis enters sixth day South East Water say more than 16,500 of the 24,000 properties impacted are now reconnected. Snowy search resumes for teen missing in Romania Mountain rescuers "make a renewed effort" to find George Smyth amid fresh snowfall. 3 hrs ago Shropshire Parents warned about 'add everyone' WhatsApp group Police have issued a warning as children are added to a WhatsApp group with explicit content. 7 hrs ago Derbyshire Doctors failed to tell dad-of-seven he was dying William Chapman only found out he had a terminal diagnosis when his GP mentioned it in passing. 7 hrs ago England Man found 'cannabis farm remains' in his new home Joe Edgson says he has been quoted £5,000 to deal with the mould and associated works. 7 hrs ago Nottinghamshire Moment earthquake shook homes in north-west England Lancashire residents say the 3.3-magnitude tremor felt like "an underground explosion", but there are no reports of damage. 26 mins ago England Summer camp sex offender to be sentenced next year Jon Ruben laced sweets with tranquilliser and gave them to children at a camp in Leicestershire. Flats evacuated after fire rips through building Residents say debris fell from the building as the blaze took hold. Heathrow drop-off charges to rise from January The UK's busiest airport is making changes which include a drop off time limit for the first time. 'Horrendous' car park potholes anger drivers Forestry England says the introduction of charges will help them repair New Forest car parks Council vans clamped in £138k parking permit mix-up Emma Bushell, of Swindon Borough Council, said: "Clearly, this has not been the council's finest hour." Stories to make you smile Rottweiler pups named after gangsters join police They are thought to be the only rottweilers in the UK being trained as general purpose police dogs. Restaurant staff 'over the moon' at penguin return The festive ornament is back at his Stevenage restaurant after he was stolen over the weekend. War veteran becomes reluctant golf champion at 101 Archie beat about 30 of his peers at his golf club to lift the over-80s trophy. Features & Analysis Salisbury poisonings inquiry due to report findings A report into the death of Dawn Sturgess, poisoned by the nerve agent Novichok in Salisbury in 2018, will be released on Thursday. 'Doctors failed to spot our boy was severely deaf' Lincolnshire health bosses have apologised to Tommy's parents and say improvements have been made. Hospitality sector could shed 100,000 more jobs, trade body warns UKHospitality is particularly worried about the impact of the recent Budget on youth employment. Parents face 12-month wait to learn how babies died Shane Bevan and Laura Tongue say it is "cruel" for grieving families to be left waiting for answers. Refugees 'living in anxiety' amid asylum reform plans Ukrainian and Syrian refugees in the South East say they are living in uncertainty. Watch/Listen Watch: Swan stops traffic on four-lane motorway Video shows the bird wandering across the M1 before being rescued by traffic officers. 5 hrs ago Northamptonshire How to decorate a cathedral at Christmas The 16ft tree, which has a 12 Days of Christmas theme, is now gracing Gloucester Cathedral. 20 hrs ago Gloucestershire The details of Kevin Sinfield's latest MND challenge Rugby league legend Kevin Sinfield is taking on seven ultramarathons in seven days. 2 days ago Neighbours argue as workers dig up front lawn Videos of the dispute are watched more than four million times after being shared on TikTok. 5 hrs ago Beds, Herts & Bucks Hare coursing suspects tracked by helicopter Officers recover two dead hares and a dead pheasant from where the suspects were seen.
away 22 hrs ago Sport Root's first ton in Australia keeps England afloat Joe Root finally makes a century in Australia to keep England afloat on a riveting first day of the second Ashes Test in Brisbane. 'Australia will have to admit he's a great' - Root hits elusive century Joe Root ends his long wait for a Test century in Australia by reaching three figures on day one of the second Ashes Test in Brisbane. Newcastle want to be 'top club in world' by 2030 Newcastle United "in the debate about being the top club in the world" according to new CEO David Hopkinson. Can anyone stop Lampard's Coventry winning the Championship? Frank Lampard's Coventry City are 10 points clear at the top of the Championship and could create history - but will anything stand in their way? Latest updates Just now New mayoral elections to be delayed in four areas of England The new mayoralties in Greater Essex, Norfolk and Suffolk, Hampshire and the Solent, and Sussex and Brighton will now be contested in 2028. Just now 23 mins ago Police ask public to register CCTV to fight crime A new media system will allow the force to request CCTV from volunteering businesses and individuals. 23 mins ago 26 mins ago Moment earthquake shook homes in north-west England Lancashire residents say the 3.3-magnitude tremor felt like "an underground explosion", but there are no reports of damage. 26 mins ago 27 mins ago Frustration on sixth day of Kent water crisis Households in areas of Kent and East Sussex have been told to boil water by South East Water. 27 mins ago 30 mins ago Tons of medical equipment saved from landfill Tons of equipment has been repurposed, with thousands saved in NHS money, the council says. 30 mins ago 1 hr ago Labour running scared over mayor reform, says Tory Candidates from all the main political parties in the region are criticising the government. 1 hr ago 1 hr ago ACL-hit female footballer's plea for more support Lucy Connolly-Brame, 20, is raising money for private surgery after suffering a serious injury. 1 hr ago 1 hr ago Care for paramedics praised after ambulance crash Two of three paramedics hurt in Friday night's crash are still being treated for their injuries. 1 hr ago 1 hr ago Teen wins national award for work with horses Kaden Wilson, 18, has won the award after becoming more confident through working with horses. 1 hr ago ...
